text: The 1921 Marquette Golden Avalanche football team was an American football team that represented Marquette University as an independent during the 1921 college football season. In its fifth and final season under head coach John J. Ryan, the team compiled an 6–2–1 record and shut out five of its nine opponents. The team defeated Michigan Agricultural (now known as Michigan State) and the Haskell Indians, but lost to Knute Rockne's Notre Dame Fighting Irish ==Schedule== ==References== Marquette Category:Marquette Golden Avalanche football seasons Category:College football undefeated seasons Marquette Golden Avalanche football
title: 1921 Marquette Golden Avalanche football team
